avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh snow of the last few days as well as the wind slabs to be found in particular at intermediate and high altitudes can be released by a single winter sport participant in some cases. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. The soft wind slabs are covered with new snow in some cases and therefore difficult to recognise.
Along the border with France On steep north, northeast and east facing slopes the avalanche danger is higher.
In particular on very steep sunny slopes and in steep rocky terrain medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large dry and moist avalanches are to be expected as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence above approximately 2400 m.

snowpackStructure.comment: In some cases the wind slabs have bonded still only poorly with the old snowpack. At elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. At low altitude only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.

tendency.comment: Gradual increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of the northwesterly wind.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In the last few days sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. These can be released by a single winter sport participant in particular on steep north, northeast and east facing slopes above approximately 2400 m. Caution is to be exercised at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.
Along the border with Switzerland On shady slopes the avalanche danger is higher.
In the regions with a lot of snow and on very steep sunny slopes small and medium-sized dry and moist avalanches are to be expected as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs are to be evaluated with care and prudence.

snowpackStructure.comment: In some cases the wind slabs have bonded still only poorly with each other and the old snowpack. Over a wide area new snow and wind slabs are lying on soft layers. Individual weak layers exist in the snowpack on wind-loaded slopes. In particular at elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.

tendency.comment: Gradual increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of the northwesterly wind.

avalancheActivity.comment:
More recent wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases in particular on northwest to east to southeast facing aspects and generally at elevated altitudes. The more recent wind slabs are to be bypassed in very steep terrain.
In particular in the regions with a lot of snow and on sunny slopes more small and medium-sized dry and moist avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation. These can occur in particular in starting zones where no previous releases have taken place.
avalancheActivity.highlights: In these regions the avalanche situation is generally favourable.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area 30 to 50 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last six days. The snowpack will be well bonded below approximately 2000 m.
In isolated cases new snow is lying on a hard crust. In all regions only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.
